page.title: 12TOURISM IN SHILLINGSTONE
page.content: Shillingstone is in the heart of Dorset and tourists are mainly the middle to older age group.Many overnight visitors are from abroad, particularly Americans and Australians who are tracing there family trees.Interest in old crafts is very great,also. There are two main establishments catering for tourists in Shillingstone,in addition to pubs throughout the area. they are the Willow Tearooms,on the main Blandford road,and Bere Marsh Cottage at the opposite end of the village.Each caters for around 40 people per week in addition to around 100+ overnight visitors per season. Of these,50% are passing to or from the West country,40% visiting Dorset and 10% visiting local boarding schools.
